tweets.text:
Looking at the replies to this it appears the truth is now out there.

The @EnvAgency are a ‚ÄúFailed and discredited organisation‚Äù. https://t.co/B2JJlcQ0hj

@EnvAgency How many of those incidents could you have stopped happening in the first place if you simply enforced existing regulations? Axe that huge tranche of mid-high management and get more people back on the ground. Act as a regulator not some weak industry conscience.

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

The changes to the sewage discharge permits in 2010 came via an appeal by @thameswater to the Planning Inspectorate. Shame on Thames for asking for them, shame on the Planning Inspectorate for upholding the appeal and shame on the @EnvAgency for accepting them without a whimper. https://t.co/kGu99tFYl4

We are currently arguing with the @EnvAgency about how they categorise and count sewage discharges. They are digging their heels in and now suggest damp ground is an acceptable reason to discharge sewage.

I've asked to interview @JamesBevanEA @EmmaEHoward George Eustice @pow_rebecca etc about this (among other things) but @DefraGovUK  @EnvAgency press office told me they were unavailable, which is odd, because I didn't specify a time or date. 
https://t.co/2tFq4IdSr2

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency We love the river Wye. Clearly it needs much better protection. Each year the algal blooms get worse. This year they say the sample labs were closed. They stop monitoring the polluted tributaries to save money. #3wyeswomen #sosriverwye #riverpollution #savethewye

tweets.text: @EnvAgency #WorldRiversDay extraordinary to claim the rivers are improving & polluters are prosecuted under your management @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd this is the true picture of the state of the rivers 2018 Gaywood river tributary once a lovely Chalkstream üí©üíÄüêüüò± https://t.co/jIsanf5EbA

This #WorldRiversDay is more important than ever. Last week @EnvAgency figures revealed that 0% of rivers and lakes in England are classed as in good health. ZERO. 

It‚Äôs never been more crucial to support action for natures recovery üëâ https://t.co/zup3vrsuz7 #WilderFuture https://t.co/ll0pdflpI9
@PJennings88 @EnvAgency Thank's for the support. There will be a powerful voice as more local groups form, gain knowledge and can act together on the big issues.
@aireriverstrust It‚Äôs a shame raw sewage is entering the river, near the Trout ladders Eastburn

tweets.text:
For #WorldRiversDay we've unlocked a NEW project video!üîìüìΩÔ∏èüéûÔ∏è
Partners:üôå@CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @NaturalEngland @CRTWalesandSW

2/2 Why are healthy rivers so important?
üíß They provide us with fresh water
üíß They protect us from flooding
üíß They support a huge variety of wildlife
üíß They help us stay happy and healthy
üíß They are crucial to the economy and support livelihoods

Sun 27th Sept is #WorldRiversDay A recent report from @EnvAgency showed only 14% of English Rivers are ecologically healthy.

Which is your local river? How could you get to know it better? What could you do to support it?

#ActsOfRiverKindness image: @jamesaldridge4 https://t.co/rKlUQOBnYy

tweets.text: In addition to the usual update, we've added provisional 2019/2020 data for 87 sites that saw flooding in November 2019 and February 2020. https://t.co/0bpMwv5hID @EnvAgency @NatResWales @ScottishEPA @deptinfra https://t.co/5TsX0387iB

Today is #WorldRiversDay. In Yorkshire & the North East we're blessed with many beautiful rivers and streams. In Yorks we've got a number projects helping to restore rivers: DNAire, Ryevitalise, Salmon to South Yorks, Doing More For The Derwent. https://t.co/yEj4KQUo78

tweets.text: It‚Äôs #WorldRiversDay ‚Äì tune in to @BBCCornwall this morning to hear the Environment Agency‚Äôs James Burke talk about our work to restore the River Camel. Old artificial structures have been removed, allowing fish to move more freely, and the floodplain habitat improved.

@jimkirkpatrick @AnnekaFrance @theriverstrust @Feargal_Sharkey @UnderwaterMedia @CleanIlkley @JohnnypalmerUk @SE_Rivers_Trust @sascampaigns @Sewagefreeswim @WindrushWasp It already erupts out of a manhole in a street at the top of the town during heavy rain, as reported to me by Matt @Ecohustler in August.  @wessexwater : time to invest in upgrading #frome town's sewage system @FromeCouncil @FromeNubNews
@UnderwaterMedia @UTSurfaceMike @EnvAgency Perhaps we should divert the Thames through the Houses of Parliament to flush out the biggest turds.

New @EnvAgency figures reveal today that 0% of rivers and lakes in England are now classed in good health. Urgent investment is needed to turn our suffering #waters into thriving blue corridors that are good for wildlife, people and business  https://t.co/dFukRDRkV0 https://t.co/B9VTpFb0cv

tweets.text: @EnvAgency This is the biggest load of cobblers you have ever come up with.  The EA has presided over the greatest decline in the quality of rivers for a century.  You should be ashamed of yourselves
Its #WorldRiversDay today! We are proud that our team won the prestigious @UKRiversAward with their excellent project to restore the iconic #Test #Itchen #chalkstreams. https://t.co/9AYlsNOMqL
@UTSurfaceMike @EnvAgency Let's work together for #worldshitday after all our rivers remove most of it

@WWTworldwide @WordsFromWez We need to plan long term for  largescale  #wetland creation to mitigate against #climatechange . Vital for CO2 absorption, #biodiversity, species migration & #flood mitigation. @ChichesterDC coastal plain key area to accommodate this natural capital @EnvAgencySE @TransitionChi https://t.co/CfCkuSaggF
